content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 936 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(936 m^2\)
Therefore, \(936 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{936}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{9}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 3 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

hint.text: Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2 (lb + bh + lh)\)

solution.text:
Area of tin sheet required for 1 box = Surface area of one box
\(= 2 (8 \times 7 + 7 \times 5 + 8 \times 5) = 262 cm^2\)
Therefore, area of tin required for 10 boxes \(= 262 \times 10\)
\(= 2620 cm^2\)

content.text: You need to create a tin box of dimensions \(8 cm \times 7 cm \times 5 cm.\) What is the area of a sheet of tin required to make 10 such tins?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area of the box

solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (34 \times 15 + 15 \times 13 + 34 \times 13) = 2294 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 2.8 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(2294 \times 2.8\)
= Rs. 6423.2

content.text: Latika needs to paint a rectangular box from the outside. The cost of painting the box is Rs. 2.8 per \(cm^2.\) If the dimensions of the box are \(34 cm \times 15 cm \times 13 cm\), what is the total cost of painting the box?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area

solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 3.3^2 = 326.7 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(3.3^2 cm^2 = 10.89 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 326.7 - 108.9 = 217.8 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 14 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(217.8 \times 14\)
= Rs. 3049.2

content.text: Five cubes of edge 3.3 cm each are placed side by side and stuck together as shown. The cost of painting is Rs 14 per \(cm^2\). What is the cost of painting the outer surface of the entire object?

hint.text: Count the number of faces that are outward facing

solution.text:
Curved Surface area of the roller \(= 2 \pi rh = 2\pi \times \frac {10}2 \times 24 = 754.29 cm^2\)
Area covered per rotation \(= 754.29 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area painted in 57 rolls \(= 754.29 \times 57 = 42994.29 cm^2\)

content.text: Last Monday, Ram painted a rectangular wall with a cylindrical paint roller. The length of the roller is 24 cm and its diameter is 10 cm. While painting, the roller rolled over 57 times completely. What surface area did Ram paint?

hint.text: How much area does the roller cover in one rotation?

solution.text: Surface Area of a cube = \(6 \times length^2 = 294 cm^2\)

solution.text: Surface Area of a cuboid = \(2(ab + bc + ca) = 2 (760.5 + 253.5 + 507) = 3042 dm^2\)

content.text: See the cuboid below, a=39 dm, b=19.5 dm, c=13 dm, Find its surface area

solution.text: Surface Area of a cylinder = \(2 \times \pi \times r \times(r + h) = 924 cm^2\)

content.text: In the cylinder below, diameter=14 cm, h=14 cm, find its surface area

solution.text:
Surface Area = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2\pi ({r_ o}^2 - {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 1056 + 792 + 176 = 2024 cm^2\)

content.text: In the hollow cylinder below, Inner Radius =6 cm, Outer Radius = 8 cm, Height = 21 cm, find its surface area
Find the surface area of the objects below:

hint.text:
Remember the following formulas:
Surface Area of the Cube:\( 6 \times side^2\)
Surface Area of the Cuboid: \(2 \times (lb + bh + lh)\)
Surface area of a cylinder:\(2\pi r(r+h)\)

solution.text:
Total surface area \(= 1536= 6 (side)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Length of side = \( \left(\sqrt {\frac {1536}{6}} \right) = 16 cm\)

content.text: A closed box in the shape of a cube has a total outer surface area of 1536 \(cm^2.\) What is the length of its side in centimetres?

hint.text: Remember that surface area of a cube is \(6 \times side^2\)
